bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Pamela Northam became First Lady when her husband Ralph Northam was sworn in as Virginia Governor on January 13, 2018 and served until January 2021. She attended Baylor University and Universtiy of Texas and prior to becoming First Lady worked as pedriatic occupational therapist, science educator, and most recently a community outreach coordinator. As First Lady, Pamela Northam chaired the Children's Cabinet and led the Northam Administration's work on improving early childhood education in Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records of Virginia First Lady Pamela Northam, 2018-2021, are housed in two boxes and are arranged alphabetically. These records document the work of the First Lady agendas, briefs, budgets, correspondence, legislation, meeting briefs, memoranda, notes, presentations, promotional materials, schedules, talking points
